duties_responsibilities.duty: Supervise and lead a team responsible for determining initial and continued eligibility for needs-based benefits including Food Supplement Benefits (SNAP), Medical Assistance, and more.
Ensure staff provide services within program guidelines and work with TANF and SNAP Employment and Training vendors to move clients to self-sufficiency.
Hire, train, coach, and discipline staff. Develop, monitor, and provide statistics on programs and staff processes.
Coordinate with social service staff, agencies, providers, and resources to provide comprehensive services for care and treatment of clients.

Represent the agency on task forces, committees, and with the general public. Provide information to clients, general public, community representative, and other agencies to explain programs and policies.
Plan and develop programs, analyze budget needs, and prepare statistical and program evaluation reports.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Social Work, Human Services, or a related field (Master's preferred)
